org.keycloak.federation.ldap.idm.query.internal

Class DefaultIdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.keycloak.federation.ldap.idm.query.internal.DefaultIdentityQuery<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T -
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    IdentityQuery<T>

    public class DefaultIdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>
extends Object
implements IdentityQuery<T>
    Default IdentityQuery implementation.
    Author:
    Shane Bryzak

    • Method Detail

      • setParameter

        public IdentityQuery<T> setParameter(QueryParameter queryParameter,
                            Object... value)
        Description copied from interface: IdentityQuery

        Set a query parameter to this query in order to filter the results.

        This method always create an equality condition. For more conditions options take a look at IdentityQueryBuilder and use the IdentityQuery.where(Condition...) instead.

        Specified by:
        setParameter in interface IdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>
        Parameters:
        queryParameter - The query parameter.
        value - The value to match for equality.
        Returns:

      • where

        public IdentityQuery<T> where(Condition... condition)
        Description copied from interface: IdentityQuery

        Add to this query the conditions that will be used to filter results.

        Any condition previously added to this query will be preserved and the new conditions added. If you want to clear the conditions you must create a new query instance.

        Specified by:
        where in interface IdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>
        Parameters:
        condition - One or more conditions created from IdentityQueryBuilder.
        Returns:

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • getResultList

        public List<T> getResultList()
        Description copied from interface: IdentityQuery

        Execute the query against the underlying identity stores and returns a list containing all instances of the type (defined when creating this query instance) that match the conditions previously specified.

        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • getResultCount

        public int getResultCount()
        Description copied from interface: IdentityQuery
        Count of all query results. It takes into account query parameters, but it doesn't take into account pagination parameter like offset and limit
        Specified by:
        getResultCount in interface IdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>
        Returns:
        count of all query results

      • setSortParameters

        public IdentityQuery<T> setSortParameters(QueryParameter... sortParameters)
        Description copied from interface: IdentityQuery
        Parameters used to sort the results. First parameter has biggest priority. For example: setSortParameter(User.LAST_NAME, User.FIRST_NAME) means that results will be sorted primarily by lastName and firstName will be used to sort only records with same lastName
        Specified by:
        setSortParameters in interface IdentityQuery<T extends IdentityType>
        Parameters:
        sortParameters - parameters to specify sort criteria
        Returns:
        this query

        Specify if sorting will be ascending (true) or descending (false)
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        sortAscending - to specify if sorting will be ascending or descending
